title: Quiz 7: Medical-Surgical Nursing (Jan 2022 FQE)
topicName: Medical Surgical Nursing FQE PastPapers Collection
description: Final Qualifying Examination from January 2022 covering acute care, oncology, and perioperative nursing.

questions.question: Hypotension in acute pancreatitis is mainly caused by:

options.text: Loss of large amounts of protein rich fluid into tissues and peritoneal cavity.
Bleeding into the tissues and peritoneal cavity.

questions.explanation: Massive third-spacing of fluid and proteins into the retroperitoneal space causes hypovolemic shock.
questions.hint: Fluid shifts out of vessels into the abdomen.

questions.question: Clinical manifestations of neurogenic shock include:

options.text: Warm dry skin, bradycardia and hypotension.
Hypothermia, warm dry skin and tachycardia.

questions.explanation: Loss of sympathetic tone causes vasodilation (warm skin, hypotension) and unopposed vagal tone (bradycardia).
questions.hint: Low BP, Slow Heart, Warm Skin.

questions.question: Hysteroscopy is indicated in:

options.text: Cases of infertility and cervical carcinoma.
Unexplained per vaginal bleeding & recurrent early pregnancy loss.
Retained intra-uterine device & acute pelvic inflammation.

questions.explanation: It visualizes the uterine cavity to find structural causes of bleeding or miscarriage.
questions.hint: Looking inside the uterus for bleeding causes.

questions.question: Abnormal findings on Breast examination include:

options.text: Longstanding nipple inversion, breast tenderness before menses.

questions.explanation: Unilateral vein prominence suggests tumor blood demand; dimpling suggests tumor invasion of ligaments.
questions.hint: Signs of a growing mass pulling on skin or needing blood.

questions.question: Early signs of cervical cancer include:

options.text: Bleeding between menstrual periods, dyspareunia and prolonged bleeding.
Heavy bleeding post intercourse, pelvic pain and unusual discharge.
Pelvic pain, unusual vaginal discharge and increased urinary frequency.
Increased urinary frequency, dyspareunia and bleeding between menstrual periods.

questions.explanation: Intermenstrual and post-coital bleeding are classic early signs.

questions.question: The primary outcome of the assessment component of the nursing process is:
questions.explanation: Assessment results in a collected database of information.

questions.question: Fracture immobilization is meant to achieve the following:

options.text: Pain relieve, reduced movement and correction of malunion
Prevention of displacement, pain relieve and reduced deformities.
Prevent muscle spasms, bone alignment and increased circulation.
Reduce malformations, restore circulation and relieve pain

questions.explanation: It stops movement (displacement) and pain.

questions.question: Match the drug with its description:
questions.explanation: Ethambutol (TB drug) causes optic neuritis. Neostigmine increases acetylcholine.
questions.hint: E for Eye, Neostigmine for Nerves.

questions.question: Stratified epithelium lines the following:

options.text: Kidney tubules, buccal cavity and the throat.
Lungs, trachea and inner lining of blood vessels.
Inner lining of blood vessels, buccal cavity and lungs.

questions.explanation: Areas subject to friction (mouth, esophagus, vagina) have stratified protection.

questions.question: A third degree burn involves:

options.text: The epidermis and a portion of the dermis.
Epidermis, upper dermis & a portion of deeper dermis.
Epidermis, entire dermis, subcutaneous & connective tissue.

questions.explanation: Full thickness means all skin layers and fat.

questions.question: The common causative bacterial pathogens for otitis media are:
questions.explanation: Pneumococcus (Strep pneumoniae) is the leading cause.

questions.question: Arrange the stages of urine formation in the correct order:
questions.explanation: Filter -> Take back what's needed -> Add wastes -> Concentrate.

questions.question: While caring for a patient in the recovery room after surgery, the nurse should notify the physician if the:
questions.explanation: A significant drop in BP (30mmHg) indicates shock or bleeding.

questions.question: Contact dermatitis is initially suspected if the rash appears:

options.text: Inflamed with weeping and crusting lesion

questions.explanation: Red bumps (papules) where the contact occurred.

questions.question: Which of the following statements regarding diabetic management are TRUE?

options.text: The skin should be cleaned with an alcohol swab before insulin injection is administered.
The onset of action for glucagon injection is 8-10min.

questions.explanation: Both statements are clinically correct.
questions.hint: Clean skin and fast sugar rescue.

questions.question: The type of blood that is called the universal donor blood is:
questions.explanation: O Negative is the universal donor.
questions.hint: O for One donor for all.

questions.question: Movement of an extremity away from the midline of the body is called:
questions.explanation: Abduction = Taking away.

questions.question: When a patient is receiving heparin therapy, the nurse should:

options.text: Remember that a sedimentation rate is ordered for monitoring blood coagulation
Observe emesis, urine, and stools for blood

questions.explanation: Monitor for bleeding (hemorrhage).

questions.question: A patient reports being allergic to penicillin. Which question would elicit the most useful information?

options.text: What infection did you have that required penicillin?
What type of allergic reaction did you have?
Did you notify your physician of the allergy?

questions.explanation: Determine reaction type (Anaphylaxis vs Nausea).

questions.question: To determine that a patient does not have bowel sounds present, the nurse would have to auscultate each quadrant for:
questions.explanation: Guidelines suggest 3-5 minutes per quadrant.

questions.question: Which problem constitutes a medical emergency?
questions.explanation: No urine (Anuria) = Kidney failure/obstruction.

questions.question: Blood cells that specifically provide cell mediated immunity are:
questions.explanation: T-cells = Cell Mediated. B-cells = Humoral.

questions.question: The hormones responsible for blood calcium levels are:
questions.explanation: Calcitonin lowers Ca; PTH raises Ca.

questions.question: The following nursing diagnosis is appropriate for a patient with renal stones:

options.text: Pain related to progressive propelling of stones as evidenced by patient's verbalization.
Acute pain related to inflammation of the urinary tract
Restlessness due to severe physical pain.

questions.explanation: Pain is caused by the stone moving.

questions.question: Possible complications of haemodialysis include:

options.text: Infection, low blood pressure, air embolus.
Infection, high blood pressure, air embolus.
Abnormal heart rhythms, high blood pressure, haemorrhage.
Allergic reactions, hypothermia, high blood pressure.

questions.explanation: Fluid removal causes Hypotension.

questions.question: When performing naso-tracheal suction, the nurse should:

options.text: Lubricate the catheter with warm water.
Advance the catheter into the trachea only during inspiration.
Suction for at least 3min before giving oxygen
Ensure the suctioning machine is at a pressure of 150mmhg

questions.explanation: Inspiration opens the airway path.
questions.hint: Go in when they breathe in.

questions.question: The following diseases are caused by bacteria:

options.text: Peritonitis, schistosomiasis, puerperal sepsis, rheumatic fever.

questions.explanation: List B is all bacterial.

questions.question: Some of the factors that predispose one to gynaecomastia are:
questions.explanation: Estrogen excess or anti-androgens cause gynecomastia.

questions.question: Distinctive drug names given by pharmaceutical companies are referred to as:
questions.explanation: Trade/Brand name.

questions.question: Low oxygen supply to the tissues is scientifically referred to as:
questions.explanation: Hypo = Low, Oxia = Oxygen.

questions.question: Pre-operative nursing interventions include:

options.text: Reducing anxiety, relieving discomfort, providing instruction and preparing the patient.
Maintaining fluid balance, managing potential complications and relieving pain.
Relieving pain, reducing anxiety, education and counselling.
Providing instruction, Care of prosthesis and maintaining fluid balance.

questions.explanation: Pre-op involves physical and psychological prep.

questions.question: The aura stage of a tonic clonic seizure is characterized by:

options.text: Visual disturbance, tingling sensations, change in mood
Auditory sensation, change in mood, loss of consciousness
Tonic contractions, temporary cessation of breathing, staring into the space
Audible cry, tonic contractions, last for 3 to 4 seconds

questions.explanation: Aura is the warning sign/sensation.

questions.question: Measures that may be taken to reduce gastro-oesophageal acid reflux include:

options.text: Taking antacids one hour after meals, avoiding alcohol.
Taking coffee immediately after meals, avoiding alcohol.
Taking antacids one hour before meals, avoiding alcohol.
Taking antacids one hour after meals, taking coffee immediately after meals.

questions.explanation: Neutralize acid after eating; avoid relaxants like alcohol.

questions.question: Obesity is associated with a BMI of:

options.text: Is a result of imbalance between fats and carbohydrates intake.
Represents excess of body carbohydrate reserve.
Is associated with a BMI of greater than 40.
Is associated with a BMI of 30 to 40

questions.explanation: BMI > 30 is Obese.

questions.question: A retention enema:

options.text: Is indicated to empty the bowel of facces
Is a means of applying local treatment
Precedes a soap and water enema

questions.explanation: It is retained to treat locally or soften.

questions.question: The sources of fluid output include:
questions.explanation: Normal output = Urine, Stool, Sweat, Breath.

questions.question: Diagnosis of cholelithiasis is mainly done by:
questions.explanation: Ultrasound is the first choice.

questions.question: When collecting sputum specimen, the nurse instructs the patient to:

options.text: Clean the mouth well before expectoration
To be in recumbent position when expectorating
To discard the first sputum and expectorate the second in the specimen bottle.
To take plenty of fluid the night before collection

questions.explanation: Rinse mouth to avoid oral bacteria.

questions.question: Arrange the stages of the grieving process (Kubler-Ross) in the correct sequence:
questions.explanation: DABDA: Denial, Anger, Bargaining, Depression, Acceptance.

questions.question: Prioritize the immediate nursing interventions for a blood transfusion reaction:

items.text: Maintain IV line with Normal Saline (new tubing)

questions.explanation: Stop first, then keep vein open with saline.

questions.question: Select the methods of High Level Disinfection (HLD):
questions.explanation: Boiling and chemical soaking are HLD. Autoclaving is Sterilization.

questions.question: Match the internal ear structure with its function:
questions.explanation: Cochlea hears; Vestibular system balances.

questions.question: Which nursing interventions are priorities for a patient with severe head injury?
questions.explanation: Airway, Neuro checks, and positioning to lower ICP.

questions.question: Arrange the steps in the pathophysiology of Asthma:
questions.explanation: Trigger -> Mediators -> Inflammation -> Spasm -> Block.

questions.question: Arrange the steps in the pathophysiology of Rheumatic Fever:
questions.explanation: Strep throat -> Antibodies -> Mistaken identity -> Attack heart.

questions.question: Select the nursing responsibilities for a post-op Vesico-Vaginal Fistula (VVF) repair patient:

options.text: Ensure continuous catheter drainage (prevent bladder distension)

questions.explanation: Keep bladder empty (catheter) and flushed (fluids).

questions.question: Which factors affect Blood Pressure?
questions.explanation: BP = CO x PVR. Volume and Viscosity affect these.

questions.question: Case Study: Mr. Nininit, Post-op Exploratory Laparotomy. Which interventions are appropriate for the first 24 hours?

richContent.content:
Post-Op Case

Patient: Mr. Nininit.
Procedure: Exploratory Laparotomy.
Time: First 24 hours.

options.text: Maintain NPO status until bowel sounds return

questions.explanation: Standard post-laparotomy care: Vitals, NPO (bowel rest), I/O, Pain control.
questions.hint: Watch for shock and wait for bowels to wake up.
